metadata.title: Glory Be
metadata.description: A short hymn of praise to the Trinity, also known as the Gloria Patri or Lesser Doxology
metadata.origin: Ancient Christian doxology, developed in early centuries of the Church
metadata.usage: Recited after psalms, decades of the Rosary, and various prayers as praise to the Trinity

la.text: Gloria Patri, et Filio, et Spiritui Sancto. Sicut erat in principio, et nunc, et semper, et in saecula saeculorum. Amen.
la.notes: Traditional Latin doxology used in liturgy

en.text: Glory be to the Father, and to the Son, and to the Holy Spirit. As it was in the beginning, is now, and ever shall be, world without end. Amen.

es.text: Gloria al Padre, y al Hijo, y al Espíritu Santo. Como era en el principio, ahora y siempre, por los siglos de los siglos. Amén.

fr.text: Gloire au Père, et au Fils, et au Saint-Esprit. Comme il était au commencement, maintenant et toujours, pour les siècles des siècles. Amen.

de.text: Ehre sei dem Vater und dem Sohn und dem Heiligen Geist. Wie es war im Anfang, so auch jetzt und allezeit und in Ewigkeit. Amen.

it.text: Gloria al Padre e al Figlio e allo Spirito Santo. Come era nel principio, e ora e sempre nei secoli dei secoli. Amen.

pt.text: Glória ao Pai, e ao Filho, e ao Espírito Santo. Como era no princípio, agora e sempre, pelos séculos dos séculos. Amém.

pl.text: Chwała Ojcu i Synowi, i Duchowi Świętemu. Jak była na początku, teraz i zawsze, i na wieki wieków. Amen.
